00003 package Value::Complex;
00004 my $pkg = 'Value::Complex';
00005 
00006 use strict; no strict "refs";
00007 our @ISA = qw(Value);
00008 our $i; our $pi;
00009 
00010 #
00011 #  Check that the inputs are:
00012 #    one or two real numbers, or
00013 #    an array ref of one or two reals, or
00014 #    a Value::Complex object
00015 #    a formula returning a real or complex
00016 #  Make a formula if either part is a formula
00017 #
00018 sub new {
00019   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00020   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00021   my $x = shift; $x = [$x,@_] if scalar(@_) > 0;
00022   return $x->inContext($context) if Value::isComplex($x) || (Value::isFormula($x) && $x->{tree}->isComplex);
00023   $x = $x->data if Value::isReal($x);
00024   $x = [$x] unless ref($x) eq 'ARRAY'; $x->[1] = 0 unless defined($x->[1]);
00025   Value::Error("Can't convert ARRAY of length %d to a Complex Number",scalar(@{$x}))
00026     unless (scalar(@{$x}) == 2);
00027   $x->[0] = Value::makeValue($x->[0],context=>$context);
00028   $x->[1] = Value::makeValue($x->[1],context=>$context);
00029   return $x->[0] if Value::isComplex($x->[0]) && scalar(@_) == 0;
00030   Value::Error("Real part can't be %s",Value::showClass($x->[0]))
00031      unless (Value::isRealNumber($x->[0]));
00032   Value::Error("Imaginary part can't be %s",Value::showClass($x->[1]))
00033      unless (Value::isRealNumber($x->[1]));
00034   return $self->formula($x) if Value::isFormula($x->[0]) || Value::isFormula($x->[1]);
00035   bless {data => $x, context => $context}, $class;
00036 }
00037 
00038 sub make {
00039   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00040   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00041   while (scalar(@_) < 2) {push(@_,0)}
00042   my $c = bless {$self->hash, data => [@_[0,1]], context => $context}, $class;
00043   foreach my $x (@{$c->{data}}) {$x = $context->Package("Real")->make($context,$x) unless Value::isValue($x)}
00044   return $c;
00045 }
00046 
00047 #
00048 #  Create a new a+b*i formula from the two parts
00049 #
00050 sub formula {
00051   my $self = shift; my $value = shift;
00052   my $formula = $self->Package("Formula")->blank($self->context);
00053   my ($l,$r) = Value::toFormula($formula,@{$value});
00054   my $I = $formula->Item("Value")->new($formula,$i);
00055   $r = $formula->Item("BOP")->new($formula,'*',$r,$I);
00056   $formula->{tree} = $formula->Item("BOP")->new($formula,'+',$l,$r);
00057   return $formula;
00058 }

00062 #
00063 sub typeRef {return $Value::Type{complex}}
00064 sub length {2}

00066 sub isZero {shift eq "0"}
00067 sub isOne {shift eq "1"}

00071 #
00072 #  Get the data from the promoted item
00073 #    (guarantees that we have an array with two elements)
00074 #
00075 sub promoteData {
00076   my $self = shift;
00077   return $self->value if Value::isComplex($self) && scalar(@_) == 0;
00078   return ($self->promote(@_))->value;
00079 }

00083 #  Binary operations

00085 
00086 sub add {
00087   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00088   my ($a,$b) = $l->value; my ($c,$d) = $r->value;
00089   return $self->inherit($other)->make($a + $c, $b + $d);
00090 }
00091 
00092 sub sub {
00093   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00094   my ($a,$b) = $l->value; my ($c,$d) = $r->value;
00095   return $self->inherit($other)->make($a - $c, $b - $d);
00096 }
00097 
00098 sub mult {
00099   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00100   my ($a,$b) = $l->value; my ($c,$d) = $r->value;
00101   return $self->inherit($other)->make($a*$c - $b*$d, $b*$c + $a*$d);
00102 }
00103 
00104 sub div {
00105   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00106   my ($a,$b) = $l->value; my ($c,$d) = $r->value;
00107   my $x = $c*$c + $d*$d;
00108   Value::Error("Division by zero") if $x->value == 0;
00109   return $self->inherit($other)->make(($a*$c + $b*$d)/$x,($b*$c - $a*$d)/$x);
00110 }
00111 
00112 sub power {
00113   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00114   my ($a,$b) = $l->value; my ($c,$d) = $r->value;
00115   return $self->inherit($other)->make(1,0) if ($a->value == 1 && $b->value == 0) || ($c->value == 0 && $d->value == 0);
00116   return $self->inherit($other)->make(0,0) if $c->value > 0 && ($a->value == 0 && $b->value == 0);
00117   return exp($r * log($l))
00118  }
00119 
00120 sub modulo {
00121   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00122   return $self->inherit($other)->make(0) if abs($r)->value == 0; # non-fuzzy check
00123   my $m = Re($l/$r)->value;
00124   my $n = int($m); $n-- if $n > $m; # act as floor() rather than int()
00125   return $l - $n*$r;
00126 }
00127 
00128 sub compare {
00129   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00130   #
00131   #  Handle periodic Complex numbers
00132   #
00133   my $m = $self->getFlag("period");
00134   if (defined $m) {
00135     $l = $l->with(period=>undef);  # make sure tests below don't use period
00136     $r = $r->with(period=>undef);
00137     if ($self->getFlag("logPeriodic")) {
00138       return 1 if abs($l)->value == 0 || abs($r)->value == 0; # non-fuzzy checks
00139       $l = log($l); $r = log($r);
00140     }
00141     $m = $self->promote($m); my $m2 = $m/2;
00142     $m2 = 3*$m/2 if $m2 == -$l; # make sure we don't get zero tolerances accidentally
00143     return $l + (($l-$r+$m2) % $m) <=> $l + $m2; # tolerances appropriate to $l centered in $m
00144   }
00145 
00146   my ($a,$b) = $l->value; my ($c,$d) = $r->value;
00147   return ($a <=> $c) if $a != $c;
00148   return ($b <=> $d);
00149 }

00156 sub arg {
00157   my ($a,$b) = promoteData(@_);
00158   return CORE::atan2($b,$a);
00159 }
00160 
00161 sub mod {
00162   my ($a,$b) = promoteData(@_);
00163   return CORE::sqrt($a*$a+$b*$b);
00164 }
00165 
00166 sub Re {return (promoteData(@_))[0]}
00167 sub Im {return (promoteData(@_))[1]}
00168 
00169 sub abs {norm(@_)}
00170 sub norm {
00171   my ($a,$b) = promoteData(@_);
00172   return CORE::sqrt($a*$a+$b*$b);
00173 }
00174 
00175 sub neg {
00176   my $self = shift; my ($a,$b) = $self->value;
00177   return $self->make(-$a,-$b);
00178 }
00179 
00180 sub conj {(shift)->twiddle(@_)}
00181 sub twiddle {
00182   my $self = shift; my ($a,$b) = $self->value;
00183   return $self->make($a,-$b);
00184 }
00185 
00186 sub exp {
00187   my $self = shift; my ($a,$b) = $self->value;
00188   my $e = CORE::exp($a);
00189   my ($c,$s) = (CORE::cos($b),CORE::sin($b));
00190   return $self->make($e*$c,$e*$s);
00191 }
00192 
00193 sub log {
00194   my $self = shift;
00195   my ($r,$t) = ($self->mod,$self->arg);
00196   Value::Error("Can't compute log of zero") if ($r == 0);
00197   return $self->make(CORE::log($r),$t);
00198 }

00200 sub sqrt {(shift)**(.5)}

00207 # sin(z) = (exp(iz) - exp(-iz))/(2i)
00208 sub sin {
00209   my $self = shift; my ($a,$b) = $self->value;
00210   my $e = CORE::exp($b); my $e1 = 1/$e;
00211   $self->make(CORE::sin($a)*($e+$e1)/2, CORE::cos($a)*($e-$e1)/2);
00212 }
00213 
00214 # cos(z) = (exp(iz) + exp(-iz))/2
00215 sub cos {
00216   my $self = shift; my ($a,$b) = $self->value;
00217   my $e = CORE::exp($b); my $e1 = 1/$e;
00218   $self->make(CORE::cos($a)*($e+$e1)/2, CORE::sin($a)*($e1-$e)/2);
00219 }

00221 # tan(z) = sin(z) / cos(z)
00222 sub tan {CORE::sin($_[0])/CORE::cos($_[0])}
00223 
00224 # sec(z) = 1 / cos(z)
00225 sub sec {1/CORE::cos($_[0])}
00226 
00227 # csc(z) = 1 / sin(z)
00228 sub csc {1/CORE::sin($_[0])}
00229 
00230 # cot(z) = cos(z) / sin(z)
00231 sub cot {CORE::cos($_[0])/CORE::sin($_[0])}
00232 
00233 # acos(z) = -i log(z + sqrt(z^2 - 1))
00234 sub acos {my $z = shift; CORE::log($z + CORE::sqrt($z*$z - 1)) * (-$i)}
00235 
00236 # asin(z) = -i log(iz + sqrt(1 - z^2))
00237 sub asin {my $z = shift; CORE::log($z*$i + CORE::sqrt(1 - $z*$z)) * (-$i)}
00238 
00239 # atan(z) = (i/2) log((i+z)/(i-z))
00240 sub atan {my $z = shift; CORE::log(($z+$i)/($i-$z))*($i/2)}
00241 
00242 # asec(z) = acos(1/z)
00243 sub asec {acos(1/$_[0])}
00244 
00245 # acsc(z) = asin(1/z)
00246 sub acsc {asin(1/$_[0])}
00247 
00248 # acot(z) = atan(1/z)
00249 sub acot {atan(1/$_[0])}
00250 
00251 # atan2(z1,z2) = atan(z1/z2)
00252 sub atan2 {
00253   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00254   $self = $self->inherit($other);
00255   my ($a,$b) = $l->value; my ($c,$d) = $r->value;
00256   if ($c->value == 0 && $d->value == 0) {
00257     return $self->make(0,0) if ($a->value == 0 && $b->value == 0);
00258     return $self->make(($a->value > 0 ? $pi/2 : -$pi/2),0);
00259   }
00260   ($a,$b) = atan($l/$r)->value;
00261   $a += $pi if $c->value < 0; $a -= 2*$pi if $a->value > $pi;
00262   return $self->make($a,$b);
00263 }

00270 # sinh(z) = (exp(z) - exp(-z))/2
00271 sub sinh {
00272   my $self = shift; my ($a,$b) = $self->value;
00273   my $e = CORE::exp($a); my $e1 = 1/$e;
00274   $self->make(CORE::cos($b)*($e-$e1)/2, CORE::sin($b)*($e+$e1)/2);
00275 }
00276 
00277 # cosh(z) = (exp(z) + exp(-z))/2
00278 sub cosh {
00279   my $self = shift; my ($a,$b) = $self->value;
00280   my $e = CORE::exp($a); my $e1 = 1/$e;
00281   $self->make(CORE::cos($b)*($e+$e1)/2, CORE::sin($b)*($e-$e1)/2);
00282 }

00300 sub acosh {my $z = shift; CORE::log($z + CORE::sqrt($z*$z - 1))}

00311 # acoth(z) = (1/2) log((1+z)/(z-1))
00312 sub acoth {my $z = shift; CORE::log((1+$z)/($z-1))/2}

00316 sub pdot {
00317   my $self = shift;
00318   my $z = $self->stringify;
00319   return $z if $z !~ /[-+]/;
00320   return "($z)";
00321 }

00323 sub string {my $self = shift; Value::Complex::format($self->{format},$self->value,'string',@_)}
00324 sub TeX {my $self = shift; Value::Complex::format($self->{format},$self->value,'TeX',@_)}

00326 #
00327 #  Try to make a pretty version of the number
00328 #
00329 sub format {
00330   my $format = shift;
00331   my ($a,$b) = (shift,shift);
00332   my $method = shift || 'string';
00333   my $equation = shift;
00334   $a = Value::Real->make($a) unless ref($a);
00335   $b = Value::Real->make($b) unless ref($b);
00336   $a->{format} = $b->{format} = $format if defined $format;
00337   my $bi = 'i';
00338   return $a->$method($equation) if $b == 0;
00339   $bi = CORE::abs($b)->with(format=>$format)->$method($equation,1) . 'i' if CORE::abs($b) !~ m/^1(\.0*)?$/;
00340   $bi = '-' . $bi if $b < 0;
00341   return $bi if $a == 0;
00342   $bi = '+' . $bi if $b > 0;
00343   $a = $a->$method($equation); $a = "($a)" if $a =~ m/E/i;
00344   return $a.$bi;
00345 }

00347 #
00348 #  Values for i and pi
00349 #
00350 $i = $pkg->make(0,1);
00351 $pi = 4*CORE::atan2(1,1);
00352 
00353 #
00354 #  So that we can use 1+3*i rather than 1+3*$i, etc.
00355 #
00356 sub i () {return $i}
00357 sub pi () {return $pi}
